intro: Micranthes rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered micranthes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to deep red, depending on the variety. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Micranthes rubriflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
